methods.javadoc: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. @return a string representation of the object.
methods.name: toString
methods.comment:
Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the
 toString method returns a string that
 "textually represents" this object. The result should
 be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a
 person to read.

return.comment: a string representation of the object.

methods.javadoc:
saves the object to an XML element
@return an XML element containing the saved state
methods.name: saveToXml
methods.comment: saves the object to an XML element

return.comment: an XML element containing the saved state

methods.javadoc:
restores the object from an XML element
@param root an XML element to restore from
methods.name: restoreFromXml
methods.comment: restores the object from an XML element

params.name: root
params.comment: an XML element to restore from

methods.javadoc: sets the workspace inactive so it can hide its tools
methods.name: setVisible
methods.comment: sets the workspace inactive so it can hide its tools

methods.javadoc:
Called by the ToolManagerImpl when ToolServices calls
 the closeTool() method.
methods.name: closeRunningTool
methods.comment:
Called by the ToolManagerImpl when ToolServices calls
 the closeTool() method.

methods.javadoc:
Close all running tools; called from the close() method in
 ToolManagerImpl which is called from the Project's close()
methods.name: close
methods.comment:
Close all running tools; called from the close() method in
 ToolManagerImpl which is called from the Project's close()
